answers.answer: Yes i think its part of the preclampsia process. They are just trying to see how bad it is. They did all that to me at 4 months. Try to relax n rest your mind so you can help lower it. Thankfully its not extremely high
My first reading was 138/94 not 138/9 lol. Thank you!!

It's to check for preeclampsia which is also called toxemia if they're not having you go to the hospital right now then they're not concerned which means that you just need to take it easy relax and try to stay calm so your blood pressure stays low and I know it's kind of hard but try to stay out of pain as much as possible because that raises your blood pressure as well your so close that everything will be just fine just relax and breath best of luck!

I have pre-eclampsia and have been hospitalized twice. Every time they do the blood tests.I is to check whether your kidneys and liver have been affected by your high blood pressure.Just take things slow, luckily you are 37 weeks already.I am only 27weeks 5days, and take meds 3x a day for it. Saw my GP today (cause my obgyn is on leave) and he says the way my blood pressure is going now, I am going to have to be hospitalized again soon..Good luck and God bless!
I agree with the ladies above. It's a sign of preeclamsia. They have to monitor it. Depending on how u r doing there is a chance of having to induce u early. If it danger ur health or the babys.

question: Today I went to my ob visit. When they first took my bp it was 138/9. They chacked my urine and there was a trace pf protein. When they were done checking me they took my bp again and it was 136/90 so they took blood. Is it normal for them to run a blood test?What will that tell? I don't go back for another week and wont get my results until probably Friday. Kinda got me worried to wait that long
title: High blood pressure at 37 weeks
